content: Hamed Hatami Hamed Hatami Associate Professor School of Computer Science McGill University Home Selected Publications All Publications Teaching Team Contact I am also affiliated with: Department of Mathematics and Statistics (Associate Member). Prior to joining McGill, I was: A Veblen Fellow at the Institute for Advanced Study and the Department of Mathematics, Princeton University; A PhD student at the University of Toronto, under the supervision of Michael Molloy and BalÃ¡zs Szegedy. My research lies at the intersection of theoretical computer science and mathematics with a focus on analytic methods. My current areas of interest include: Learning Theory Complexity Theory Analysis of Boolean functions Additive Combinatorics Lecture notes & Surveys: Analysis of Boolean functions (Comp 760). Advanced complexity theory (Comp 531). H. Hatami and Pooya Hatami, Structure in Communication Complexity and Constant-Cost Complexity Classes, SIGACT news, to appear. [arXiv] Higher order Fourier analysis and applications, with Pooya Hatami and Shachar Lovett (Foundations and Trends in Theoretical Computer Science). You can download the prepublished draft.
